lines.content: --  It is common to recieve code from differet teams that need to be inserted into your project.
lines.html_content: -- It is common to recieve code from differet teams that need to be inserted into your project.

lines.content: --  However, you don't have access to that code and may not be sure the returning data is correct.
lines.html_content: -- However, you don't have access to that code and may not be sure the returning data is correct.
--

lines.content: --  This project requires you to write three DIFFERENT sort routines for integer arrays and determine the validity of those sorts.
lines.html_content: -- This project requires you to write three DIFFERENT sort routines for integer arrays and determine the validity of those sorts.

lines.content: --  You can reuse the code from previous efforts.
lines.html_content: -- You can reuse the code from previous efforts.
--

lines.content: --  SORTER.ADS provides the type declaration for an integer array of unknown size. It has a
lines.html_content: -- SORTER.ADS provides the type declaration for an integer array of unknown size. It has a

lines.content: --  private section that identifies the size of a small, medium and anything else would be a large array.  The private section
lines.html_content: -- private section that identifies the size of a small, medium and anything else would be a large array. The private section

lines.content: --  section also contains the calls to subsequent routines based on array size.
lines.html_content: -- section also contains the calls to subsequent routines based on array size.

lines.content: --  Notice Spark Mode is set to ON
lines.html_content: -- Notice Spark Mode is set to ON
--

lines.content: --  SORTER.ADB is where you need to encode the specific sort routines for the small, medium or large
lines.html_content: -- SORTER.ADB is where you need to encode the specific sort routines for the small, medium or large

lines.content: --  array.  You only have access to call the SORT procedure and it determines which subsequent procedure
lines.html_content: -- array. You only have access to call the SORT procedure and it determines which subsequent procedure

lines.content: --  gets invoked.  You will need to code each sorting routine, but you are not allowed to
lines.html_content: -- gets invoked. You will need to code each sorting routine, but you are not allowed to

lines.content: --  to modify SORT.  The SORTER.ADB must not produce any output other than returning a sorted array. You
lines.html_content: -- to modify SORT. The SORTER.ADB must not produce any output other than returning a sorted array. You

lines.content: --  will submit your SORTER.ADB file.  Notice Spark Mode is set to ON
lines.html_content: -- will submit your SORTER.ADB file. Notice Spark Mode is set to ON
--

lines.html_content: -- BEFORE YOU MAKE ANY MODIFICATIONS:

lines.content: --   You are to run Spark->Examine All
lines.html_content: -- You are to run Spark->Examine All

lines.content: --   Ensure the Multiprocess box is checked and Analysis Mode is set as Flow Analysis
lines.html_content: -- Ensure the Multiprocess box is checked and Analysis Mode is set as Flow Analysis

lines.content: --   Ensure this appears:  gnatprove -P%PP -j0 %X --mode=flow --output=oneline --ide-progress-bar

lines.html_content: -- Ensure the Multiprocess box is checked and Prove level is set to Fast (0 level)

lines.content: --  For your program, comment out Spark_mode(on) and reset the declaration to array(1..max)
lines.html_content: -- For your program, comment out Spark_mode(on) and reset the declaration to array(1..max)
--

lines.content: --  Your program must read in a file of a fixed size (denoted by Max). But, you have to ask the user to
lines.html_content: -- Your program must read in a file of a fixed size (denoted by Max). But, you have to ask the user to

lines.content: --  enter the number of valid entries that are in the array.  For example, there may be 1000 elements in the array
lines.html_content: -- enter the number of valid entries that are in the array. For example, there may be 1000 elements in the array

lines.content: --  but only 100 of them are valid.  The number of valid entries needs to be stored in the variable Sorter.Count
lines.html_content: -- but only 100 of them are valid. The number of valid entries needs to be stored in the variable Sorter.Count

lines.content: --  which is defined in Sorter.ads You must ensure that Sorter.Count, when set, is itself valid.
lines.html_content: -- which is defined in Sorter.ads You must ensure that Sorter.Count, when set, is itself valid.

lines.content: --  The valid entries will always start at the first array position and will be continuous. Sorter is based on
lines.html_content: -- The valid entries will always start at the first array position and will be continuous. Sorter is based on

lines.content: --  receiveing arrays of a fixed size (determined by the value of Max).
lines.html_content: -- receiveing arrays of a fixed size (determined by the value of Max).
--

lines.content: --  Your drvr code has to validate that the proper amount of the array was sorted and the rest of the array
lines.html_content: -- Your drvr code has to validate that the proper amount of the array was sorted and the rest of the array

lines.content: --  is unmodified. It should produce the following output:
lines.html_content: -- is unmodified. It should produce the following output:
--

lines.content: --  The size of the Array is XXX of which YYY are valid.
lines.html_content: -- The size of the Array is XXX of which YYY are valid.

lines.content: --  Then one of the following:
lines.html_content: -- Then one of the following:

lines.content: --      Array was sorted, remainder of the array was unmodified
lines.html_content: -- Array was sorted, remainder of the array was unmodified

lines.content: --      Array was sorted, remainder of array was modified
lines.html_content: -- Array was sorted, remainder of array was modified

lines.content: --      Array was not sorted, remainder of array was unmodified
lines.html_content: -- Array was not sorted, remainder of array was unmodified

lines.content: --      Array was not sorted, remainder of array was modified
lines.html_content: -- Array was not sorted, remainder of array was modified
--

lines.content: pragma Spark_mode (on);
lines.html_content: pragma Spark_mode (on);

lines.content: with Ada.Text_IO; use Ada.text_io;
lines.html_content: with Ada.Text_IO; use Ada.text_io;

lines.content: with Ada.Integer_Text_IO; use Ada.Integer_Text_IO;
lines.html_content: with Ada.Integer_Text_IO; use Ada.Integer_Text_IO;

lines.content: with Sorter; use Sorter;
lines.html_content: with Sorter; use Sorter;

lines.content: procedure Drvr is
lines.html_content: procedure Drvr is

lines.content: rand_file : File_Type;         -- input file which is 10k integers (this may vary in the final run but will be <= Max
lines.html_content: rand_file : File_Type; -- input file which is 10k integers (this may vary in the final run but will be <= Max

lines.content: Max : Integer := 10000;     -- this is set on the size of the datafile, it is guarenteed to be greater than zero
lines.html_content: Max : Integer := 10000; -- this is set on the size of the datafile, it is guarenteed to be greater than zero

lines.content: -- and no larger than the datafile, there is no need to check for this
lines.html_content: -- and no larger than the datafile, there is no need to check for this

lines.content: A : array_type(1..max);
lines.html_content: A : array_type(1..max);

lines.content: begin
lines.html_content: begin

lines.content: open(rand_file, In_File, ".\src\random10k.txt");-- opens a 10,000 element data file in the src directory
lines.html_content: open(rand_file, In_File, ".\src\random10k.txt");-- opens a 10,000 element data file in the src directory

lines.content: for i in 1..max loop
lines.html_content: for i in 1..max loop

lines.content: get(rand_file,A(i)); -- reads data from a text file
lines.html_content: get(rand_file,A(i)); -- reads data from a text file

lines.content: end loop;
lines.html_content: end loop;

lines.content: close(rand_file); -- close the file (often forgotten)
lines.html_content: close(rand_file); -- close the file (often forgotten)

lines.content: end Drvr;
lines.html_content: end Drvr;
